snippet: With Prime Minister Narendra Modi pushing economic growth and better governance, the Obama administration has cast his election as a chance to bolster economic ties.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry travels to India to meet with Prime Min Narendra Modi in effort to lay the basis for expanded cooperation before Modi travels to Washington in September; with Modi championing the need for economic growth and better governance, Obama administration is using his election as an opportunity to strengthen economic ties and work more closely on security and climate change issues.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and GARDINER HARRIS

lead_paragraph: With Prime Minister Narendra Modi pushing economic growth and better governance, the Obama administration has cast his election as a chance to bolster economic ties.

headline.main: In India, Kerry to Meet New Prime Minister and Seek Improved Relations
headline.print_headline: In India, Kerry to Meet New Prime Minister and Seek Improved Relations
